Secondary Education The Education Department (Secondary) Zilla Parishad, Pune works under the School Education Department of the Maharashtra Government. It manages all government approved secondary schools in the district including Aided, Unaided, Permanently Unaided, Self-financed schools and various medium schools. These schools cover different grades such as Std. 5 th to 10 th, Std. 5 th to 12 th, Std. 8 th to 10 th and Std. 8 th to 12 th. Several student Centric government schemes are implemented in all schools and the detailed information regarding these schemes is provided accordingly. Every year, as per government criteria post fixation is carried out and based on that teachers salaries in aided schools are disbursed through the payment unit. The Education Officer (Secondary) acts as the head of both the Pay Unit and Education Department (Secondary) overseeing various works and ensuring various schemes are delivered to the beneficiaries with the help of their subordinate officers and employees. In the era of information and technology the work of the Education Department (Secondary) is facilitated through computer assistance. Accordingly the information about various circulars, government resolutions and various schemes under the Education Department (Secondary) is provided via the official website. Similarly actions related to staff fixation, provident fund, medical bills etc. are processed. The department actively works towards enhancing educational standards in district schools through student quality assessments, school inspections and innovative initiatives. Various Schemes:- Sr. No Scheme Name STD Schemes Information 1 National Means-Cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme (NMMSS) Grades 9 to 12 This centrally sponsored scheme was initiated in the year 2007-08. Eligible students studying in Grade 8 undergo an examination conducted annually at the state level by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune. Selected students receive a monthly scholarship of ‚Çπ1,000, totaling ‚Çπ12,000 annually for education up to Grade 12. The objective of this scheme is to support students from economically weaker sections to pursue secondary-level education, reduce dropouts and provide financial assistance to intelligent students for further studies.¬∑ This scheme applies to students in government, local body and private aided schools. The annual income of parents should not exceed ‚Çπ3,50,000, and the income certificate should be duly signed by a competent authority. At the district level, the organization of this examination is carried out annually by the Education Officer, Secondary of Pune Zilla Parishad. 2 National Talent Search Exam (NTS) Grades 10 to Higher Education This scheme is implemented by the Central Government for students studying in Grade 10.¬∑ The exam is conducted in two stages: state level and central level, organized by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune. Through this exam, talented students from Grade 10 are selected for scholarships. Students studying in government-recognized aided secondary schools are eligible for this exam. 3 Science Exhibition Grades 6 to 12 Science exhibitions are organized annually at the taluka and district levels under the guidance of the State Institute of Science Education, Nagpur. The aim is to develop students scientific perspective, observation skills and experimental proficiency, enabling them to contribute to the nations progress through creative actions. Students from recognized schools (Grades 6 to 12) divided into six groups, along with teachers and laboratory assistants, can participate. Students selected at the taluka level participate in district-level science exhibitions and those selected at the district level proceed to state-level exhibitions. Each year, NCERT provides a primary theme and subtopics for the science exhibitions. Based on these, students, with the help of their guiding teachers, create scientific projects/models. The implementation of this scheme at the district/taluka level is carried out by the Secondary Education Department office. 4 INSPIRE AWARD MANAK Grades 6 to 10 This scheme has been implemented since 2009-2010 by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India. It helps enhance creativity and innovation among students through this initiative. School registration and nomination of students are done by the Headmasters on the E- MIAS web portal. Selected students receive ‚Çπ10,000 (through Direct Benefit Transfer) into their accounts to develop innovative projects/models, funded at the central government level. Students selected at the district level participate in the state-level science exhibition and those selected at the state level proceed to the national-level science exhibition. The implementation of this scheme at the district level is managed by the Secondary Education Department office. Frequently Asked Questions:- Sr.No QUESTION ANSWER 1 Can institutions recruit teachers directly instead of using the Pavitra Portal? Except for minority institutions, other institutions cannot recruit teachers directly without using the Pavitra Portal. 2 How should the vacant clerical positions be filled? After adjustments from surplus to deficit based on approval, further action will be taken to fill vacant positions as per government orders. 3 What is the required land area to start a self-financed new school? 1 acre of land is required. 4 Through which office is personal approval given for junior college employees? The Deputy Director of Education Office, Pune Division, Pune. 5 Is in-service training required for senior pay scale promotions? No, it is not required. 6 Is it necessary for eligible teachers to receive the senior grade before selection grade? Yes, it is necessary. 7 How should the seniority list be prepared? It should be prepared as per Rule 12, Schedule F of the MEPS Act 1981, and the Government Decision dated May 3, 2019. 8 What documents are needed for changing a student‚Äôs caste? Caste certificate of the student, caste validity certificate, parent‚Äôs affidavit, Form 3. 9 What documents are required for changing a student‚Äôs name? Birth certificate of the student, gazette notification, parent‚Äôs affidavit, ration card, Forms 1 and 2. 10 How to submit nominations under the Inspire Award Scheme? Register the school on the E-MIAS web portal of the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, and then register the nominations of the students. Telephone : 020-26050733 Address : District Level Office
Secondary Education
Secondary Education
Secondary Education
Secondary Education
The Education Department (Secondary) Zilla Parishad, Pune works under the School Education Department of the Maharashtra Government. It manages all government approved secondary schools in the district including Aided, Unaided, Permanently Unaided, Self-financed schools and various medium schools. These schools cover different grades such as Std. 5 th to 10 th, Std. 5 th to 12 th, Std. 8 th to 10 th and Std. 8 th to 12 th. Several student Centric government schemes are implemented in all schools and the detailed information regarding these schemes is provided accordingly. Every year, as per government criteria post fixation is carried out and based on that teachers salaries in aided schools are disbursed through the payment unit. The Education Officer (Secondary) acts as the head of both the Pay Unit and Education Department (Secondary) overseeing various works and ensuring various schemes are delivered to the beneficiaries with the help of their subordinate officers and employees. In the era of information and technology the work of the Education Department (Secondary) is facilitated through computer assistance. Accordingly the information about various circulars, government resolutions and various schemes under the Education Department (Secondary) is provided via the official website. Similarly actions related to staff fixation, provident fund, medical bills etc. are processed. The department actively works towards enhancing educational standards in district schools through student quality assessments, school inspections and innovative initiatives. Various Schemes:- Sr. No Scheme Name STD Schemes Information 1 National Means-Cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme (NMMSS) Grades 9 to 12 This centrally sponsored scheme was initiated in the year 2007-08. Eligible students studying in Grade 8 undergo an examination conducted annually at the state level by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune. Selected students receive a monthly scholarship of ‚Çπ1,000, totaling ‚Çπ12,000 annually for education up to Grade 12. The objective of this scheme is to support students from economically weaker sections to pursue secondary-level education, reduce dropouts and provide financial assistance to intelligent students for further studies.¬∑ This scheme applies to students in government, local body and private aided schools. The annual income of parents should not exceed ‚Çπ3,50,000, and the income certificate should be duly signed by a competent authority. At the district level, the organization of this examination is carried out annually by the Education Officer, Secondary of Pune Zilla Parishad. 2 National Talent Search Exam (NTS) Grades 10 to Higher Education This scheme is implemented by the Central Government for students studying in Grade 10.¬∑ The exam is conducted in two stages: state level and central level, organized by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune. Through this exam, talented students from Grade 10 are selected for scholarships. Each year, NCERT provides a primary theme and subtopics for the science exhibitions. Based on these, students, with the help of their guiding teachers, create scientific projects/models. The implementation of this scheme at the district/taluka level is carried out by the Secondary Education Department office. 4 INSPIRE AWARD MANAK Grades 6 to 10 This scheme has been implemented since 2009-2010 by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India. It helps enhance creativity and innovation among students through this initiative. School registration and nomination of students are done by the Headmasters on the E- MIAS web portal. Selected students receive ‚Çπ10,000 (through Direct Benefit Transfer) into their accounts to develop innovative projects/models, funded at the central government level. Students selected at the district level participate in the state-level science exhibition and those selected at the state level proceed to the national-level science exhibition. The implementation of this scheme at the district level is managed by the Secondary Education Department office. Frequently Asked Questions:- Sr.No QUESTION ANSWER 1 Can institutions recruit teachers directly instead of using the Pavitra Portal? Except for minority institutions, other institutions cannot recruit teachers directly without using the Pavitra Portal. 2 How should the vacant clerical positions be filled? After adjustments from surplus to deficit based on approval, further action will be taken to fill vacant positions as per government orders. 3 What is the required land area to start a self-financed new school? 1 acre of land is required. 4 Through which office is personal approval given for junior college employees? The Deputy Director of Education Office, Pune Division, Pune. 5 Is in-service training required for senior pay scale promotions? No, it is not required. 6 Is it necessary for eligible teachers to receive the senior grade before selection grade? Yes, it is necessary. 7 How should the seniority list be prepared? It should be prepared as per Rule 12, Schedule F of the MEPS Act 1981, and the Government Decision dated May 3, 2019. 8 What documents are needed for changing a student‚Äôs caste? Caste certificate of the student, caste validity certificate, parent‚Äôs affidavit, Form 3. 9 What documents are required for changing a student‚Äôs name? Birth certificate of the student, gazette notification, parent‚Äôs affidavit, ration card, Forms 1 and 2. 10 How to submit nominations under the Inspire Award Scheme? Register the school on the E-MIAS web portal of the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, and then register the nominations of the students. Telephone : 020-26050733 Address : District Level Office
The Education Department (Secondary) Zilla Parishad, Pune works under the School Education Department of the Maharashtra Government. It manages all government approved secondary schools in the district including Aided, Unaided, Permanently Unaided, Self-financed schools and various medium schools. These schools cover different grades such as Std. 5 th to 10 th, Std. 5 th to 12 th, Std. 8 th to 10 th and Std. 8 th to 12 th.
Several student Centric government schemes are implemented in all schools and the detailed information regarding these schemes is provided accordingly. Every year, as per government criteria post fixation is carried out and based on that teachers salaries in aided schools are disbursed through the payment unit. The Education Officer (Secondary) acts as the head of both the Pay Unit and Education Department (Secondary) overseeing various works and ensuring various schemes are delivered to the beneficiaries with the help of their subordinate officers and employees.
In the era of information and technology the work of the Education Department (Secondary) is facilitated through computer assistance. Accordingly the information about various circulars, government resolutions and various schemes under the Education Department (Secondary) is provided via the official website. Similarly actions related to staff fixation, provident fund, medical bills etc. are processed. The department actively works towards enhancing educational standards in district schools through student quality assessments, school inspections and innovative initiatives.
Various Schemes:-
Sr. No
Scheme Name
STD
Schemes Information
1
National Means-Cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme (NMMSS)
Grades 9 to 12
This centrally sponsored scheme was initiated in the year 2007-08. Eligible students studying in Grade 8 undergo an examination conducted annually at the state level by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune. Selected students receive a monthly scholarship of ‚Çπ1,000, totaling ‚Çπ12,000 annually for education up to Grade 12. The objective of this scheme is to support students from economically weaker sections to pursue secondary-level education, reduce dropouts and provide financial assistance to intelligent students for further studies.¬∑ This scheme applies to students in government, local body and private aided schools. The annual income of parents should not exceed ‚Çπ3,50,000, and the income certificate should be duly signed by a competent authority. At the district level, the organization of this examination is carried out annually by the Education Officer, Secondary of Pune Zilla Parishad.
This centrally sponsored scheme was initiated in the year 2007-08.
Eligible students studying in Grade 8 undergo an examination conducted annually at the state level by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune.
Selected students receive a monthly scholarship of ‚Çπ1,000, totaling ‚Çπ12,000 annually for education up to Grade 12.
The objective of this scheme is to support students from economically weaker sections to pursue secondary-level education, reduce dropouts and provide financial assistance to intelligent students for further studies.¬∑
This scheme applies to students in government, local body and private aided schools.
The annual income of parents should not exceed ‚Çπ3,50,000, and the income certificate should be duly signed by a competent authority.
At the district level, the organization of this examination is carried out annually by the Education Officer, Secondary of Pune Zilla Parishad.
2
National Talent Search Exam (NTS)
Grades 10 to Higher Education
This scheme is implemented by the Central Government for students studying in Grade 10.¬∑ The exam is conducted in two stages: state level and central level, organized by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune. Through this exam, talented students from Grade 10 are selected for scholarships. Students studying in government-recognized aided secondary schools are eligible for this exam.
This scheme is implemented by the Central Government for students studying in Grade 10.¬∑
The exam is conducted in two stages: state level and central level, organized by the Maharashtra State Council of Examinations, Pune.
Through this exam, talented students from Grade 10 are selected for scholarships.
Students studying in government-recognized aided secondary schools are eligible for this exam.
3
Science Exhibition
Grades 6 to 12
Science exhibitions are organized annually at the taluka and district levels under the guidance of the State Institute of Science Education, Nagpur. The aim is to develop students scientific perspective, observation skills and experimental proficiency, enabling them to contribute to the nations progress through creative actions. Students from recognized schools (Grades 6 to 12) divided into six groups, along with teachers and laboratory assistants, can participate. Students selected at the taluka level participate in district-level science exhibitions and those selected at the district level proceed to state-level exhibitions. Each year, NCERT provides a primary theme and subtopics for the science exhibitions. Based on these, students, with the help of their guiding teachers, create scientific projects/models. The implementation of this scheme at the district/taluka level is carried out by the Secondary Education Department office.
Science exhibitions are organized annually at the taluka and district levels under the guidance of the State Institute of Science Education, Nagpur.
The aim is to develop students scientific perspective, observation skills and experimental proficiency, enabling them to contribute to the nations progress through creative actions.
Students from recognized schools (Grades 6 to 12) divided into six groups, along with teachers and laboratory assistants, can participate.
Students selected at the taluka level participate in district-level science exhibitions and those selected at the district level proceed to state-level exhibitions.
Each year, NCERT provides a primary theme and subtopics for the science exhibitions. Based on these, students, with the help of their guiding teachers, create scientific projects/models.
The implementation of this scheme at the district/taluka level is carried out by the Secondary Education Department office.
4
INSPIRE AWARD MANAK
Grades 6 to 10
This scheme has been implemented since 2009-2010 by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India. It helps enhance creativity and innovation among students through this initiative. School registration and nomination of students are done by the Headmasters on the E- MIAS web portal. Selected students receive ‚Çπ10,000 (through Direct Benefit Transfer) into their accounts to develop innovative projects/models, funded at the central government level. Students selected at the district level participate in the state-level science exhibition and those selected at the state level proceed to the national-level science exhibition. The implementation of this scheme at the district level is managed by the Secondary Education Department office.
This scheme has been implemented since 2009-2010 by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India.
It helps enhance creativity and innovation among students through this initiative. School registration and nomination of students are done by the Headmasters on the E- MIAS web portal.
Selected students receive ‚Çπ10,000 (through Direct Benefit Transfer) into their accounts to develop innovative projects/models, funded at the central government level.
Students selected at the district level participate in the state-level science exhibition and those selected at the state level proceed to the national-level science exhibition.
The implementation of this scheme at the district level is managed by the Secondary Education Department office.
Frequently Asked Questions:-
Sr.No
QUESTION
ANSWER
1
Can institutions recruit teachers directly instead of using the Pavitra Portal?
Except for minority institutions, other institutions cannot recruit teachers directly without using the Pavitra Portal.
2
How should the vacant clerical positions be filled?
After adjustments from surplus to deficit based on approval, further action will be taken to fill vacant positions as per government orders.
3
What is the required land area to start a self-financed new school?
1 acre of land is required.
4
Through which office is personal approval given for junior college employees?
The Deputy Director of Education Office, Pune Division, Pune.
5
Is in-service training required for senior pay scale promotions?
No, it is not required.
6
Is it necessary for eligible teachers to receive the senior grade before selection grade?
Yes, it is necessary.
7
How should the seniority list be prepared?
It should be prepared as per Rule 12, Schedule F of the MEPS Act 1981, and the Government Decision dated May 3, 2019.
8
What documents are needed for changing a student‚Äôs caste?
Caste certificate of the student, caste validity certificate, parent‚Äôs affidavit, Form 3.
9
What documents are required for changing a student‚Äôs name?
Birth certificate of the student, gazette notification, parent‚Äôs affidavit, ration card, Forms 1 and 2.
10
How to submit nominations under the Inspire Award Scheme?
Register the school on the E-MIAS web portal of the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, and then register the nominations of the students.
Telephone : 020-26050733
Address : District Level Office

‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä
‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø
‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£
‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§®
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ
‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£
‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£
‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞
‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä
‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ
‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶
‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨
‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä
‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§®
‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§®
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ )
‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤
‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§¨‡§Ç‡§¶
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Secondary Education Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Secondary Education Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Secondary Education Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Secondary Education

‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†
Secondary Education
Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
Print
Print
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
Secondary Education Under the School Education Department of the Government of Maharashtra, the Secondary Education Department of the Zilla Parishad is operational. The Education Officer for Secondary Education oversees both the Secondary Education Department and the Pay Unit. This Secondary Education Department manages all government-recognized private management secondary schools within the district including aided, unaided, and self-finance. This department administers these schools based on educational levels such as Grades 5 to 10, Grades 5 to 12, Grades 8 to 10, and Grades 8 to 12. The administration of these schools is carried out through the Secondary Education Department and its activities include the following Various schemes of the Central and State Government, such as scholarship programs, science exhibitions and the Inspire Award scheme are implemented through this department. These schemes are delivered to beneficiaries with the assistance of regional officers and staff working under this department. Following the directives of the government and higher offices, tasks related to school approvals, Pavitra Portal, Bindu Namavali, SARAL, and similar administrative work are carried out. Work related to the Grade 10 and Grade 12 examinations is conducted annually as per the guidelines of the Maharashtra State Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board, Pune. The monthly salary of teachers in aided schools, arrears bills, and operations related to the Provident Fund are processed through the Pay Unit of this office. Various administrative tasks are undertaken by this office, including annual inspections of secondary and higher secondary schools, initial approval inspections, accreditation inspections, SEMI English approval inspections, self-financed approvals, and verification of typing institutions. Corrections to student caste, name and date of birth in school records are made based on the school‚Äôs recommendation as per entries in the admission and discharge register. In the era of information and technology, most of the department‚Äôs work is performed with the help of computers. Accordingly, various government decisions, circulars, and information about different schemes are made available to citizens through the website. Report of Approved and Operational Staff as of 25/03/2025 Sr.No Level of Post DesignationApproved Officers/Employees working Vacancies Employees under State Government 1 EducationOfficer(Secondary) 1 1 0 2 DeputyEducationOfficers(Secondary) 5 1 4 3 Superintendent (Grade 2) 1 1 0 4 District Science Supervisor 1 1 0 5 AssistantEducationInspectors 1 1 0 6 Senior Clerk 3 0 3 7 Driver 1 0 1 8 Peon 1 0 1 Total 14 5 9 Employees under Zilla Parishad 9 Superintendent (Grade 3) 1 0 1 10 ExtensionOfficer(Education) 8 3 5 11 SeniorAssistant 8 7 1 12 JuniorAssistant 12 11 1 13 Peon 4 3 1 Total 33 24 9 Final Total 47 29 18

Secondary Education
Under the School Education Department of the Government of Maharashtra, the Secondary Education Department of the Zilla Parishad is operational. The Education Officer for Secondary Education oversees both the Secondary Education Department and the Pay Unit. This Secondary Education Department manages all government-recognized private management secondary schools within the district including aided, unaided, and self-finance. This department administers these schools based on educational levels such as Grades 5 to 10, Grades 5 to 12, Grades 8 to 10, and Grades 8 to 12. The administration of these schools is carried out through the Secondary Education Department and its activities include the following Various schemes of the Central and State Government, such as scholarship programs, science exhibitions and the Inspire Award scheme are implemented through this department. These schemes are delivered to beneficiaries with the assistance of regional officers and staff working under this department. Following the directives of the government and higher offices, tasks related to school approvals, Pavitra Portal, Bindu Namavali, SARAL, and similar administrative work are carried out. Work related to the Grade 10 and Grade 12 examinations is conducted annually as per the guidelines of the Maharashtra State Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board, Pune. The monthly salary of teachers in aided schools, arrears bills, and operations related to the Provident Fund are processed through the Pay Unit of this office. Various administrative tasks are undertaken by this office, including annual inspections of secondary and higher secondary schools, initial approval inspections, accreditation inspections, SEMI English approval inspections, self-financed approvals, and verification of typing institutions. Corrections to student caste, name and date of birth in school records are made based on the school‚Äôs recommendation as per entries in the admission and discharge register. In the era of information and technology, most of the department‚Äôs work is performed with the help of computers. Accordingly, various government decisions, circulars, and information about different schemes are made available to citizens through the website. Under the School Education Department of the Government of Maharashtra, the Secondary Education Department of the Zilla Parishad is operational. The Education Officer for Secondary Education oversees both the Secondary Education Department and the Pay Unit. This Secondary Education Department manages all government-recognized private management secondary schools within the district including aided, unaided, and self-finance.
This department administers these schools based on educational levels such as Grades 5 to 10, Grades 5 to 12, Grades 8 to 10, and Grades 8 to 12. The administration of these schools is carried out through the Secondary Education Department and its activities include the following
Various schemes of the Central and State Government, such as scholarship programs, science exhibitions and the Inspire Award scheme are implemented through this department. These schemes are delivered to beneficiaries with the assistance of regional officers and staff working under this department.
Following the directives of the government and higher offices, tasks related to school approvals, Pavitra Portal, Bindu Namavali, SARAL, and similar administrative work are carried out.
Work related to the Grade 10 and Grade 12 examinations is conducted annually as per the guidelines of the Maharashtra State Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board, Pune.
The monthly salary of teachers in aided schools, arrears bills, and operations related to the Provident Fund are processed through the Pay Unit of this office.
Various administrative tasks are undertaken by this office, including annual inspections of secondary and higher secondary schools, initial approval inspections, accreditation inspections, SEMI English approval inspections, self-financed approvals, and verification of typing institutions.
Corrections to student caste, name and date of birth in school records are made based on the school‚Äôs recommendation as per entries in the admission and discharge register.
In the era of information and technology, most of the department‚Äôs work is performed with the help of computers. Accordingly, various government decisions, circulars, and information about different schemes are made available to citizens through the website.

TITLE: ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ | ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•á | ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§

English ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§¶‡•Å‡§µ‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡•á ‡§∞‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§ï‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ü ‡§â‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ï‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ü ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ü ‡§π‡§æ‡§Ø‡§≤‡§æ‡§á‡§ü ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∏ Invert Saturation ‡§Æ‡§ú‡§ï‡•Ç‡§∞ ‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§´‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü ‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§¢‡§µ‡§æ ‡§´‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü ‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§´‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü ‡§Æ‡§ú‡§ï‡•Ç‡§∞ ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•á‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§â‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä Others Hide Images Big Cursor ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® Government of Maharashtra

‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä
‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø
‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£
‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§®
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ
‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£
‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£
‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞
‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä
‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ
‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶
‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨
‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä
‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§®
‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§®
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ )
‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤
‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§¨‡§Ç‡§¶
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ

‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ

‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ, ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§´‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó ‡§µ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§Æ‡§≤‡§¨‡§ú‡§æ‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•á. ‡§∏‡§¶‡§∞‡§ö‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø ‡§π‡•á ‡§è‡§ï ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•Ç‡§® ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡•ß‡•Æ‡•¨‡•¶ ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ï ‡§è‡§Æ.‡§è.‡§è‡§ö.‡•Æ‡•ß‡•´/‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•á/‡•Æ‡•ß, ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ï ‡•ß‡•¶ ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§ü‡•á‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞ ‡•ß‡•Ø‡•Æ‡•ß ‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§π‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§æ.‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•á‡§ï‡§°‡•á ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§Ü‡§π‡•á. ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ. i) ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡•ß.‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‚Äì ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£. ‡•®.‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§®‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•Ä ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®(PM-JANMAN). ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡•ß.‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§à ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•®.‡§∂‡§¨‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•©. ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§ß‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•™. ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•´.‡§Ø‡§∂‡§µ‡§Ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ ‡§ö‡§µ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ‡§£ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§∏‡§æ‡§π‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•¨. ‡§Ö‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•≠.‡§™‡§Ç‡§°‡§ø‡§§ ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≥ ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ ‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§π‡§æ‡§Ø‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•Æ.‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï ‡§Ö‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä ‡§π‡•ã‡§≥‡§ï‡§∞ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡•ß.‡§Ø‡§∂‡§µ‡§Ç‡§§ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•®.‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ii) ‡§â‡§Æ‡•á‡§¶(MSRLM). iii) ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§§ ‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú ‡§¨‡§Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ/‡§≤‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£ ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç‡§°‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•É‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ. iv) DDUGKY(‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≥ ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§ï‡•å‡§∂‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ). ‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡§ß‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡•Ä : 020-26131784 ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ : ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡•á
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ, ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§´‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó ‡§µ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§Æ‡§≤‡§¨‡§ú‡§æ‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•á. ‡§∏‡§¶‡§∞‡§ö‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø ‡§π‡•á ‡§è‡§ï ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•Ç‡§® ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡•ß‡•Æ‡•¨‡•¶ ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ï ‡§è‡§Æ.‡§è.‡§è‡§ö.‡•Æ‡•ß‡•´/‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•á/‡•Æ‡•ß, ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ï ‡•ß‡•¶ ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§ü‡•á‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞ ‡•ß‡•Ø‡•Æ‡•ß ‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§π‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§æ.‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•á‡§ï‡§°‡•á ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§Ü‡§π‡•á. ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ. i) ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡•ß.‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‚Äì ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£. ‡•®.‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§®‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•Ä ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®(PM-JANMAN). ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡•ß.‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§à ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•®.‡§∂‡§¨‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•©. ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§ß‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•™. ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•´.‡§Ø‡§∂‡§µ‡§Ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ ‡§ö‡§µ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ‡§£ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§∏‡§æ‡§π‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•¨. ‡§Ö‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•≠.‡§™‡§Ç‡§°‡§ø‡§§ ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≥ ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ ‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§π‡§æ‡§Ø‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•Æ.‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï ‡§Ö‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä ‡§π‡•ã‡§≥‡§ï‡§∞ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡•ß.‡§Ø‡§∂‡§µ‡§Ç‡§§ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‡•®.‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ii) ‡§â‡§Æ‡•á‡§¶(MSRLM). iii) ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§§ ‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú ‡§¨‡§Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ/‡§≤‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£ ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç‡§°‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•É‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ. iv) DDUGKY(‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≥ ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§ï‡•å‡§∂‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ). ‡§¶‡•Ç‡§∞‡§ß‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡•Ä : 020-26131784 ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ : ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡•á
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ, ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§´‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó ‡§µ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§Æ‡§≤‡§¨‡§ú‡§æ‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•á‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡•á. ‡§∏‡§¶‡§∞‡§ö‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø ‡§π‡•á ‡§è‡§ï ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•Ç‡§® ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡•ß‡•Æ‡•¨‡•¶ ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ï ‡§è‡§Æ.‡§è.‡§è‡§ö.‡•Æ‡•ß‡•´/‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•á/‡•Æ‡•ß, ‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ï ‡•ß‡•¶ ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§ü‡•á‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞ ‡•ß‡•Ø‡•Æ‡•ß ‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§π‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§æ.‡§ß‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•á‡§ï‡§°‡•á ‡§®‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡§£‡•Ä‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§Ü‡§π‡•á.
‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ.
i) ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤
‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡•ß.‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ ‚Äì ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£.
‡•®.‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§®‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•Ä ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®(PM-JANMAN).
‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡•ß.‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§à ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•®.‡§∂‡§¨‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•©. ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§ß‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•™. ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•´.‡§Ø‡§∂‡§µ‡§Ç‡§§‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ ‡§ö‡§µ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ‡§£ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§∏‡§æ‡§π‡§§ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•¨. ‡§Ö‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Ü‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•≠.‡§™‡§Ç‡§°‡§ø‡§§ ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≥ ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ ‡§ñ‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§π‡§æ‡§Ø‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•Æ.‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï ‡§Ö‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡•Ä ‡§π‡•ã‡§≥‡§ï‡§∞ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡•ß.‡§Ø‡§∂‡§µ‡§Ç‡§§ ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
‡•®.‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§ò‡§∞‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ
ii) ‡§â‡§Æ‡•á‡§¶(MSRLM).
iii) ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§§ ‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú ‡§¨‡§Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ/‡§≤‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£ ‡§§‡§æ‡§Ç‡§°‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•É‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ.
iv) DDUGKY(‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≥ ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§ï‡•å‡§∂‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ).

District Rural Development Agency The District Rural Development Agency , Pune Office implements various central and state sponsored schemes. The said office is an autonomous organization and is registered with the Hon‚Äôble Charity Commissioner under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, Registration No. M.A.H.815/Pune/81 , dated 10th September 1981. Housing: * Central Government Sponsored Scheme 1. Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana ‚Äì Rural. 2. Pradhan Mantri Janjati Tribal Justice Maha Abhiyan (PM-JANMAN). * State Government Sponsored Scheme 1. Ramai Awas Yojana 2. Shabari Awas Yojana 3. Pardhi Awas Yojana 4. Modi Awas Yojana 5. Yashwantrao Chavan Mukt Vasahat Yojana 6. Atal Kamgar Awas Yojana 7. Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay Gharkul Land Purchase Assistance Scheme 8. Punyashlok Ahilya Devi Holkar Gharkul Yojana * Zilla Parishad Sponsored Scheme 1. Yashwant Gharkul Yojana 2. Divyang Gharkul Yojana Central Government Other Scheme 1. Umed (MSRLM). 2. Sant Sevalal Maharaj Banjara /Laman Tanda Prosperity Scheme. 3. DDUGKY (Deendayal Upadhyay Rural Skill Scheme). Telephone : 020-26131784 Address : District Level Office
District Rural Development Agency

District Rural Development Agency
District Rural Development Agency
The District Rural Development Agency , Pune Office implements various central and state sponsored schemes. The said office is an autonomous organization and is registered with the Hon‚Äôble Charity Commissioner under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, Registration No. M.A.H.815/Pune/81 , dated 10th September 1981. Housing: * Central Government Sponsored Scheme 1. Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana ‚Äì Rural. 2. Pradhan Mantri Janjati Tribal Justice Maha Abhiyan (PM-JANMAN). * State Government Sponsored Scheme 1. Ramai Awas Yojana 2. Shabari Awas Yojana 3. Pardhi Awas Yojana 4. Modi Awas Yojana 5. Yashwantrao Chavan Mukt Vasahat Yojana 6. Atal Kamgar Awas Yojana 7. Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay Gharkul Land Purchase Assistance Scheme 8. Punyashlok Ahilya Devi Holkar Gharkul Yojana * Zilla Parishad Sponsored Scheme 1. Yashwant Gharkul Yojana 2. Divyang Gharkul Yojana Central Government Other Scheme 1. Umed (MSRLM). 2. Sant Sevalal Maharaj Banjara /Laman Tanda Prosperity Scheme. 3. DDUGKY (Deendayal Upadhyay Rural Skill Scheme). Telephone : 020-26131784 Address : District Level Office
The District Rural Development Agency , Pune Office implements various central and state sponsored schemes. The said office is an autonomous organization and is registered with the Hon‚Äôble Charity Commissioner under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, Registration No. M.A.H.815/Pune/81 , dated 10th September 1981.

‡§Æ‡•á‡§®‡•Ç ‡§ü‡•â‡§ó‡§≤
‡§Æ‡•á‡§®‡•Ç ‡§ü‡•â‡§ó‡§≤
‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£ ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤ ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§†
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø ‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä
‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ø
‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§® ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§æ
‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ú ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§Æ‡§π‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§µ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§≤‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§™‡§∂‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•Ä ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§µ‡§†‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞
‡§¨‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ß‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‚Äì ‡§¶‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§£
‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§µ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡§®
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ( ‡§≤ ‚Äå.‡§™‡§æ ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó
‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ
‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Ø‡•Ä ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£
‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§£
‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§æ/‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞
‡§ï‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§
‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä
‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡•á / ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•á ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Æ
‡§®‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡§®‡§¶
‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§ú‡§®‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•Ä, ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´
‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§∑‡§¶ ‡§Ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡•®‡•¶‡•®‡•´-‡•®‡•¨
‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä
‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§°‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•â‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§∞ ‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§®
‡§õ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡§®
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ ) ‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á
‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï (‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏/ ‡§è‡§™‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§à‡§ì‡§∏ / ‡§è‡§è‡§∏ )
‡§ë‡§®‡§≤‡§æ‡§à‡§® ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§ü‡§≤
‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§π‡§ï‡•ç‚Äç‡§ï
‡§∏‡•Ç‡§ö‡§®‡§æ
‡§¨‡§Ç‡§¶
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Primary Education Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Primary Education Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Primary Education Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§† Primary Education

Primary Education
Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
Print ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ

‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§´‡•á‡§∏‡§¨‡•Å‡§ï ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§ü‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ü‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§ï ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§°‡§á‡§®‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•á‡§Ö‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ
Primary Education Under the Primary Education Department of Pune Zilla Parishad, education is provided to boys and girls from 1st to 7th standard through Zilla Parishad Primary Schools . At the district level, the Education Officer (Primary) is the head of the department and at the taluka level, the Group Education Officer is the head of the taluka. In order to provide quality education to students from 1st to 7th standard , various schemes sponsored by the Central Government and sponsored by the State Government are implemented through the Primary Education Department of the Zilla Parishad, Pune.
Primary Education
Primary Education
Primary Education
Primary Education
Under the Primary Education Department of Pune Zilla Parishad, education is provided to boys and girls from 1st to 7th standard through Zilla Parishad Primary Schools . At the district level, the Education Officer (Primary) is the head of the department and at the taluka level, the Group Education Officer is the head of the taluka. In order to provide quality education to students from 1st to 7th standard , various schemes sponsored by the Central Government and sponsored by the State Government are implemented through the Primary Education Department of the Zilla Parishad, Pune.
Under the Primary Education Department of Pune Zilla Parishad, education is provided to boys and girls from 1st to 7th standard through Zilla Parishad Primary Schools . At the district level, the Education Officer (Primary) is the head of the department and at the taluka level, the Group Education Officer is the head of the taluka. In order to provide quality education to students from 1st to 7th standard , various schemes sponsored by the Central Government and sponsored by the State Government are implemented through the Primary Education Department of the Zilla Parishad, Pune.
Under the Primary Education Department of Pune Zilla Parishad, education is provided to boys and girls from 1st to 7th standard through Zilla Parishad Primary Schools . At the district level, the Education Officer (Primary) is the head of the department and at the taluka level, the Group Education Officer is the head of the taluka. In order to provide quality education to students from 1st to 7th standard , various schemes sponsored by the Central Government and sponsored by the State Government are implemented through the Primary Education Department of the Zilla Parishad, Pune.

English ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§¶‡•Å‡§µ‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡•á ‡§∞‡§Ç‡§ó ‡§ï‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ü ‡§â‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö ‡§ï‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ü ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ü ‡§π‡§æ‡§Ø‡§≤‡§æ‡§á‡§ü ‡§≤‡§ø‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∏ Invert Saturation ‡§Æ‡§ú‡§ï‡•Ç‡§∞ ‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§´‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü ‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§¢‡§µ‡§æ ‡§´‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü ‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§∞‡§æ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§´‡•â‡§®‡•ç‡§ü ‡§Æ‡§ú‡§ï‡•Ç‡§∞ ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•á‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§â‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä Others Hide Images Big Cursor ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® Government of Maharashtra

‡§â‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•á ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§ï‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§ö‡§®‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∂‡§æ‡§∏‡§® ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§•‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§£ ‡§ú‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§π‡§æ
